questions.question: Please drive ………………………………
questions.description: Use the adverb carefully to modify the verb drive.

questions.question: How is your grandmother today? Is she any …………………………..?
questions.description: Use the comparative form when there is an idea of change.

questions.question: She can speak English really ……………………………..
questions.description: We use the adverb well to modify the verb speak.

questions.question: Despite working …………………………….., he couldn’t get the promotion.
questions.description: Hard can be an adjective and an adverb. Hardly is similar to scarcely.

questions.question: The cops ran ……………………………….. and soon caught the thief.
questions.description: Fast can be an adjective and an adverb. There is no such word as fastly.

questions.question: We …………………………….. see lions.
questions.description: Rarely is similar to seldom. Hardly is similar to scarcely.

questions.question: My dog can understand everything. He is …………………………. human.
No …………………………… had she arrived than trouble started brewing.
The mother is ……………………………… waiting for her son to return.
questions.description: Here the adverb anxiously modifies the verb is waiting.

questions.question: All of a ………………………….. he appeared from nowhere.
Why are you speaking so ………………………………?
questions.description: Here the adverb loudly modifies the verb speaking.

questions.question: He played …………………………… yesterday.
questions.description: Well is an adverb and good is an adjective. We need an adverb to modify the verb played.

questions.question: He drives ……………………………
questions.description: Carefully is an adverb and careful is an adjective. We need an adverb to modify the verb drives.

questions.question: He looks …………………………..
questions.description: Look is a copular verb we use adjectives to modify copular verbs.

questions.question: She has a ………………………………. smile.
questions.description: Lovely is an adjective modifying the noun smile.

questions.question: Cyanide is …………………………….. poison.
questions.description: Deadly is an adjective meaning fatal.

questions.question: He drove as ………………………….. as he could.
questions.description: Fast can be an adjective or adverb.

questions.question: He works ……………………………. because he has a family to support.
questions.description: Hard can be adjective or adverb. Hardly means scarcely.

questions.question: There was …………………………….. any water in the pond.
questions.description: Hardly means scarcely.

questions.question: They were …………………………… informed.
questions.description: Promptly is an adverb used to modify the verb were informed.

questions.question: Thank you for your …………………………….. reply.
questions.description: Prompt is an adjective modifying the noun reply.

questions.question: I am ………………………….. waiting for my results.
questions.description: Eagerly is the adverb modifying the verb am waiting.

questions.question: The soup tasted .......................................
questions.description: Taste is a copular verb we use adjectives to modify copular verbs.
